com.nimsoft.nimbus
Class NimConfig

java.lang.Object
  com.nimsoft.nimbus.NimConfig
Direct Known Subclasses:
OrderedConfig
public class NimConfig
extends Object

Configuration class used by the probe. Supporting the config file layout used by the 'C' and Perl probes An example of a config file used in jUnit testing is: 

 lt;config>
 <java>
      key1 = alfs
      key2 = 24
      key4 = true
      key5 = 3.14
 </java>
 <l2>
     <l30>
         k1.30 = x30
         k2.30 = 30
     </l30>
     <l31>
         k1.31 = x31
         k2.31 = 31
     </l31>
     <l32>
         k1.32 = x32
         k2.32 = 32
     </l32>
     k1.2 = x2
     k2.2 = 2
     k2.3 = true
 </l2>
 lt;/config>

A number of methods are available to get and set configuration values. A value is found given the section and the key. In addition two methods are available retrieving all keys and subsections in a defined section.

Snippet 

 .....
      // A number of methods with answers
      NimConfig config = NimConfig.getInstance();
      config.setFilename("config.txt");
      String[] sectionkeylist = config.getSectionList("config/l2"); // The answer is an array with the keys "l30", "l31", "l32"
      String[] keylist = config.getKeyList("config/l2");            // The answer is an array with the keys "k1.2","k2.2", "k2.3"  
      int i =  config.getValueAsInt("config/java","key2",0);        // The answer is 24
      int i2 =  config.getValueAsInt("config/java","key3",0);       // The answer 0 because the key does not exist and efault value is returned
      double d =  config.getValueAsDouble("config/java","key5",0.0);// The answer is 3.14

Constructor Detail

NimConfig

protected NimConfig()

NimConfig

public NimConfig(PDS pds)
          throws NimException
Construct a config from a PDS. This constructor is typically used when receiving config files "over the wire" as an PDS. 
 The constructor supports two formats:
 A pds with sub-pds for each section and key / value if any in each sub-pds
 A flat pds with key / value where the key contains full path with sections + key

Parameters:
pds - The pds
Throws:
NimException

NimConfig

public NimConfig(String filename)
          throws NimException
Construct a config given a filename. This constructor may typically be used for "private" config files

Parameters:
filename - The config file name
Throws:
NimException

getCharset

public Charset getCharset()
Return the Charset that NimConfig will use to read and write files. The character set can be set (intended mostly for unit tests) using System.setProperty("file.encoding", charset).

Since:
2.9.7

@Deprecated
public String getValueDecrypted(String[] sections,
                                           String key,
                                           String seed)
                         throws NimException
Deprecated. use getValueDecryptedUTF8(String[], String, String) instead, or specify the character set explicitly using getValueDecryptedCharset(String[], String, String, String)

Get a config value as a String. This method uses the default character set for the JVM in order to convert the decrypted bytes to a String.

Parameters:
sections - An array with sections
key - The key
seed - The seed
Returns:
The found value for the given key
Throws:
NimException - The NimException may be thrown

getValueDecryptedUTF8

public String getValueDecryptedUTF8(String section,
                                    String key,
                                    String seed)
                             throws NimException
Decrypt the value for the given key, using UTF-8 as the character set.

Parameters:
section - the / delimited section path
key - the key for the encrypted value
seed - the seed to use to decrypt the value
Returns:
the decrypted (plain-text) string
Throws:
NimException - if getValue fails
Since:
2.88

getValueDecryptedCharset

public String getValueDecryptedCharset(String[] sections,
                                       String key,
                                       String seed,
                                       String charset)
                                throws NimException,
                                       UnsupportedEncodingException
Decrypt the value for the given key.

Parameters:
sections - the section path
key - the key for the encrypted value
seed - the seed to use to decrypt the value
charset - the character set to use for the seed and to interpret the decrypted bytes as a String
Returns:
the decrypted (plain-text) string
Throws:
NimException - if getValue fails
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the given character set is not supported by the JVM
Since:
2.88

setValueEncrypted

@Deprecated
public void setValueEncrypted(String sections,
                                         String key,
                                         String value,
                                         String seed)
                       throws NimException
Deprecated. use setValueEncryptedUTF8(String, String, String, String) instead, or specify the character set explicitly using setValueEncryptedCharset(String[], String, String, String, String)

Encrypt and set a config value. This uses the platform default character set to convert Strings to bytes for encryption and may not preserve extended characters (Chinese and Japanese especially).

Parameters:
sections - Sections delimited with '/'
key - The key
value - The String value
seed - Seed for encryption
Throws:
NimException - The NimException may be thrown

public void setValueEncryptedUTF8(String section,
                                  String key,
                                  String value,
                                  String seed)
                           throws NimException
Set an encrypted value in this NimConfig object, using UTF-8 as the character set.

Parameters:
section - the section
key - the key to set
value - the value to encrypt and then set
seed - the seed to use for the encryption
Throws:
NimException - if the value cannot be set
Since:
2.88

setValueEncryptedUTF8

public void setValueEncryptedUTF8(String[] sections,
                                  String key,
                                  String value,
                                  String seed)
                           throws NimException
Set an encrypted value in this NimConfig object, using UTF-8 as the character set.

Parameters:
sections - the sections array
key - the key to set
value - the value to encrypt and then set
seed - the seed to use for the encryption
Throws:
NimException - if the value cannot be set
Since:
2.88

setValueEncryptedCharset

public void setValueEncryptedCharset(String[] sections,
                                     String key,
                                     String value,
                                     String seed,
                                     String charset)
                              throws NimException,
                                     UnsupportedEncodingException
Set an encrypted value in this NimConfig object.

Parameters:
sections - the sections array
key - the key to set
value - the value to encrypt and then set
seed - the seed to use for the encryption
charset - the character set to use to convert the seed and value to bytes for the encryption algorithm
Throws:
NimException - if the value cannot be set
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the given character set is not supported by the JVM.
Since:
2.88

getPDS

public PDS getPDS(boolean flatformat)
           throws NimException
Get the config as an PDS, ready to be sent "over the wire". 
 The method supports two formats:
 A pds with subpds for each section and key / value if any in each subpds
 A flat pds with key / value where the key contains full path with sections + key (flatformat = true)

Parameters:
flatformat - True if flatformat is wanted
Returns:
The PDS representation of the config
Throws:
NimException

getPDS

protected void getPDS(String section,
                      boolean flatformat,
                      PDS pds)
               throws NimException
Throws:
NimException
